comments.body:
You should change scala212 to be `2.12.14`, we try to keep on the latest version in Metals, and add `2.12.13` here. You will most likely need to set ammonite212Version to `2.12.14` if it's not yet published.

```
[error] error: The ExplicitResultTypes rule only supports the exact Scala versions 
'List(2.12.13, 2.12.11, 2.12.12)' for this binary version.
```
ach, ok, we can update it later.
and the same for ammonite
I know this is already merged, but does the snapshot resolver need to stay in here?
It's useful for testing out snapshot releases. We can remove it for sure, but it shouldn't matter too much.

comments.body:
It seems that we have a large regression in 0.27 and no completions coming from scala library are not displayed.
This way most large tests will be run on 0.26, which works and I will focus on fixing it upstream before the release.
Link to the regression https://github.com/lampepfl/dotty/issues/9760
This ensures that if the test is not found then it will go into the first group

Just a note, but I've noticed the build definition is getting pretty large. I'm normally in favor of starting to move methods out into `project/x` once things start getting this large. Just something to think about for the future as we continually add more.
The package name seems odd, but it is indeed just `testng`. I figured this was a nice small one to include for this purpose.

comments.body: I know we briefly hit on this before, but why do we say that `2.13.0` is deprecated, but not `2.12.10`. I fee like we should be consistent with that across 2.12 and 2.13.

`2.13.0` was released a while ago and had a couple of issue, so I don't think we can recommend that. `2.13.1` was quickly released with the fixes. `2.12.10` is still in use by a lot of codebases and it`s only recently that the new version was released.

I might be missing it, but is `s` not used at all?
You are right, it's removed.

comments.body: is `gson` not suitable for exporting? It is already pulled in from `lsp4j`

The bloop export logic originally started as a separate project that I ended up folding into the Metals codebase. I would prefer not to refactor to gson since it requires a fair amount of work for questionable gain. ujson is a pretty small dependency as well.

We're also bringing circe via `bloop-config` so we'd actually have three json libraries on the classpath 🙈

We can deprecate it with the next version, since it's working now.

comments.body: are you replicating the `^` logic by hand? Was it broken?
I get it now, thanks :)

The primary motivation was to use `+` instead of `^`, it's conceptually easier IMO to have to only think about the Scala version, especially when it comes to publishing all modules. I think sbt doesn't work this way by default in order to be able to hypothetically support multiple sbt versions on the same Scala version.
This will effectively introduce a regression wrt the PR merged yesterday that made pid optional during initialization. Can we release a 0.1.1 of lsp4s and depend on it?
Good point, I've pushed a v0.2.0 tag to lsp4s. Fortunately, we were able to bundle the breaking change with other jsonrpc breaking changes so this time it's fine to release jsonrpc and ls4s together.

comments.body: Can we set `name := "metalsRoot"` in the top-level?
